urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

tweets.text:
The @EnvAgency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from @TheENDSReport.
https://t.co/6vI9ZC2H8l

@nigwill99 @TheENDSReport @EnvAgency Why do you mention sewage but not agriculture or industry? The latter two combined are far more polluting than sewage. Sewage is a point source discharge, legally consented by EA. Agriculture far less so and is therefore not visibly obvious in a river,but is highly destructive.

The @EnvAgency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from @TheENDSReport.
https://t.co/6vI9ZC2H8l

urls.title: India’s huge tobacco burden and the need for harm reduction alternatives such as ENDS – From The Desk of Dr K K Aggarwal
urls.description: Reproduced from ETHealthWorld | May 01, 2019, 03:05 IST With 120 million tobacco smokers, India is the second largest consumer of combustion-based tobacco products globally and witnesses over one million deaths per year due to tobacco related illness. Centre for Health Law, Policy and Ethics, University of Ottawa Tobacco smoking is one of the world’s and India’s biggest and most preventable cause of early death and a blight on culture and society. With 120 million tobacco smokers, India is the second

@SimonTagg @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @KeeleUniversity @StaffsFire @NewsNBC @AaronBell4NUL I think after this is sorted we need to look back through meetings and minutes. People raised concerns, they didn't seem to matter. 

Get this sorted and then get educated as to WHO and HOW this was allowed to happen, more waste dumped, and then enact your democratic vote.

@SimonTagg @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @KeeleUniversity @StaffsFire @NewsNBC @AaronBell4NUL Going be a very sad day if they ever do have a gas leak but it gets ignored because they presume its the tip. How many residents this could be a potential situation for.

entity.description: Good morning, Britain. Up early and need to catch up on the latest news, weather and sports? Then this weekday morning programme is for you, offering the latest information in such areas as entertainment, health and money. `Good Morning Britain' is the typical morning news and talk show. It features a number of presenters, correspondents and reporters covering what you should know to start your day before heading out the door.

tweets.text: Smell from Walleys landfill is pretty bad again. They ask when we report it to Environmental Health what number the odour is. No number is acceptable. @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids

It is now very clear the the @EnvAgencyMids is either inept, or corrupt. 2000 plus residents complained re: stench from @redindustries2 at Walley’s quarry, they “forgot” to turn on their monitoring equipment and didn’t want to send out staff due to safety fears @AaronBell4NUL

We recognise concerns about odour around #WalleysQuarry landfill & how difficult this is for local people. We’ve had officers out today to check odour & will continue to do so. We’re aware of increased wait times on our hotline so please remember you can email us too. https://t.co/Oj3QeLcCfq

The last time this was reported (again) was in the Autumn of 2020 under incident No. 1851979

EA have the powers to stop this so why aren't they? 🤔 https://t.co/RsSv9zSRTQ

‼️🚨 WALLEY'S - CONFIRMED BREACH OF SITE PERMIT 🚨‼️

The @EnvAgencyMids have confirmed a breach of the site permit. This is very concerning.

Clearly the odour *is* causing annoyance. I will continue to put the pressure on with the EA and at Westminster.

https://t.co/9vl5xaQgzq https://t.co/Cae8tqcrf3
